clinical_study.brief_title: On-Pump vs. Off-Pump CABG in High-Risk Patients (EuroSCORE 6+)
clinical_study.official_title: Aortocoronary Bypasses in High-Risk Patients (EuroSCORE 6+) With or Without Use of the Cardio-Pulmonary Bypass.

brief_summary.textblock: Previous studies comparing on-pump and off-pump operating strategy did only partially demonstrate benefits of the off-pump myocardial revascularisation.In primary end-points (MI, death, renal failure, and so on) there was no significant difference, but in secondary end-points we observed benefits resulting for patients. We would like to show the benefit of the method without extracorporeal circulation in patients with higher and hight operation risk, coming from EuroSCORE classification system (6 points and more).

primary_outcome.measure: death, heart stroke, brain stroke, renal failure, early reoperation
heart stroke, brain stroke, death, renal failure, early reoperation

secondary_outcome.measure: length of in-hospital stay, blood losses, number of blood-transfusion, new appeared atrial fibrillation, 1-year mortality, quality of life-angina classified by CCS in 1-year follow up, length of mechanical ventilation

arm_group.description: Patients with ischemic heart disease, with EuroSCORE 6 additive points and more, operated with use of the cardio-pulmonary bypass
Patients with ischemic heart disease, with EuroSCORE 6 additive points and more, operated without use of the cardio-pulmonary bypass

intervention.intervention_name: OPCAB - the off-pump coronary artery bypass
intervention.description: surgical myocardial revascularisation without use of cardio-pulmonary bypass, using stabilising devices on beating heart

study_pop.textblock: People indicated for surgical myocardial revascularisation with high surgical risk

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- stable form of ischemic heart disease
- unstable angina pectoris
- acute myocardial infarction
- additive EuroSCORE 6 and more
- informed approval of the patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- significant heart valve disease, requesting surgery
- aortic aneurysm requesting surgery

facility.name: 2nd Surgical Dpt. of 1st Faculty of Medicine of Charles University, Prague
